name: 王清祿
objective:
本課程設計重點有三：(1)藉由精選的中級程度教材加強學生必備的基礎文法觀念和句型結構；(2)使學生確切把握閱讀要領以及充分瞭解寫作的各種技巧，重心在生字、片語、句法的解釋和基本寫作技巧的分析；(3)透過練習加強聽、說、讀、寫的知能及表達。
中 文
課程名稱：英文
授課教師：王清祿
課程簡介：
壹、前言：主攻閱讀能力
本英文課定位在中級或以上的大學閱讀。由於每週僅有兩小時，非常珍貴，所以不同於
高中教學，以大學需求為考量，同時顧及本校學生的程度、特性、及學習狀況。
貳、教學策略與教材
一、閱讀為主－－強調（1）大量閱讀。（2）快速閱讀與理解、深度與批判。區隔其他
課程，如會話、聽力。透過閱讀訓練學習語法、結構與作文技巧。
二、輔助教材－－若教科書無法滿足學生和本課程的需求，則不定時加發講義：（1）
語言學習類：本人撰寫的英文學習專題，如文法綱要、閱讀方法等。（2）科技類：熱
門科技議題與未來趨勢的。（3）人文類：勵志、人生、文學、幽默、藝術等。（4）應
用類：有關大學生的讀書技巧，如學習方法、如何做筆記等。以上四大類視學生學習情
況做調整。
三、培養興趣－－鼓勵同學利用本校提供的周邊學習管道，如《英語角落》、《看電影
學英文》、《新聞英語》、或線上《全民英檢模擬考題》等。如有必要，挑選一部份納
入本課程。
參、結語：四大目標
本課程針對本校主修科技的學生，透過教學材料的啟發性、創意、知識性、實用性、以
及娛樂性，（1）提升同學英語文能力、（2）誘發英語學習興趣、（3）培養健康的英
文學習觀念與方法、（4）進而提升人文與科技素養。

Course Title:  English
Instructor:  Wang Ching-lu （王清祿）
Course Description:
I.  Introduction: Focus on Reading Skills
This course aims to equip students with intermediate or higher reading
skills in focus on:  (1) speed reading in large quantity and (2)
in-depth
and critical reading.  Other skill areas such as grammar, sentence
structures, and writing are also taught through reading activities.
II.  Teaching Materials
Aside from required textbook readings, handouts will be given as
supporting
if textbooks are insufficient to meet the needs of students and the
course.
Included in the handouts could be: (1) my lectures on essential English
grammar and reading skills;  (2) essays on technology and humanity;
(3)
prose or literature about life, humor, encouragement, art, etc.;  (4)
articles about survival skills for college students in academic life
such as
study and note-taking methods.  The selection of reading materials is
based
on the criteria: inspirational, original, informative, entertaining,
and
practical.
Another aim of this course is to engage students in various outside
English-learning programs made available by the English Department of
the
NTUT.  Among them are English Corner, Learning English through Film,
Learning English through Newspaper, Online GEPT, to name but a few.
Since
these programs provide diverse learner-oriented activities that enhance
students' English ability, if necessary, some of these programs will go
into
this course.
III.  Conclusion: the Purposes
On the whole, this course is designed specifically for the majority of
NTUT
science-based majors in ways that help them (1) enhance language
acquisition, (2) form good reading and English-learning habits,  (3)
develop
students' interest in English, and (4) promote humanity and  technology
literacy.       ■
